### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:What home entertainment equipment requires cable? Choices:  A: radio shack B: substation C: cabinet D: television E: desk<n>Output:		A: radio shack<n><n>#### Solution:<n>```py<n>import math<n>n=math.floor<n><n>def levenshtein_distances(source1,target1,source2,target2):<n>    dp=[[0 for j in range(4)] for i in range(4)]  #dp table<n>    dp[0][0]=0 #dp[0][0]=source distanc to [0] of target<n>    dp[-1][-1]=math.inf #dp[-1][-1] equals target distanc to [x][y] or "infinity" <n>    for h1 in range(1,len(source1)):<n>        for h2 in range(1,4):<n>            if h1!=0 and source1[h1]!=source1[0]:<n>        #if source1 changed, or target<n>            dp[h1-1][h2]=n(dp[h1-1],[h2-1])+n(dp[h-1],[h2])+(4 if source1[h1-1]=='X' else 1)  #dp[h1-2,h2-2]=d+1, d=4 or 1<n>            dp[0][h2]=n([]) +n([source1[h1-2]])+(1)<n>    d=len(source1)<n>    for h1,x1 in enumerate(target1):<n>        for h2,x2 in enumerate(target2):<n>            if x1!=x2:<n>            if source1[h-1]==source2[h-1]:<n>            if 4!=h:<n>                dp[h-1][h2-1]=n(dp[0,h2-1])-1  #dp[0][h-1]-1 in cases, where source did not change<n>                d=(h-1)<n>        dp[0][1] = d+4<n>     #this values are in fact the distance of 1 letter to [0][1]<n>    return dp<n><n>def main():<n>    source1 = "where is the library?"<n>    target1 = "where is that library?"<n>    source2 = "what home entertainment requires cable?"<n>    target2 = "

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:How do geese normally get from place to place? Choices:  A: carried by people B: guard house C: fly D: follow ultralight airplane E: group together<n>Output:		E: group together<n>--------------------------------------------------<n><n>### Code: Please complete this file.<n>```python<n><n>import sys<n><n><n>def answer(input_a, input_b, input_e, solution):<n>    if input_e == solution:<n>        print("Solution: " + input_a + " = " + input_b + " = " + solution + ".")<n>        sys.exit()<n>    else:<n>        print("Input E: " + input_e + " was incorrect. " + input_a<n>              + " = " + answer("Apparatus", input_b, input "appliance", solution)<n>              + " = "+ input_c + " = " +<n>              answer("Fuel Tank", input_d, input_f, solution)<n>              +" = " + input_g + ".")<n>        input_a = input("Type 1: > ")<n>        input_b = input("Type 2: > ")<n>        answer(input_a=input_a, input=input_b, input_f=input_f, input_g=input_g,solution=input_f)<n>        <n><n>answer("Apparatus", "A", "Wash Dishes", "W")<n>answer("Fuel Tank")<n>answer("Car","B", "Fuel Tank", "G")<n>answer("Group Together", "A", "Follow Ultralight Plane", "C")<n>input()<n>```<n><n>### Output<n>```<n><n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: kick the bucket B: mortal C: dead D: can die E: dying<n>Output:		C: dead <n>                        <n>################## IMPLEMENT START ##### <n>class Solution:<n>    def singleNumber(self, nums):<n>        counter = 0 <n>        for num in nums: <n>            counter += num <n>        return counter

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? D: fry less E: Bake more, but not burn the food<n>Output: B: learn to fry more<n><n>--- Part Two ---<n><n>You must write a program that takes a piece of text on standard input containing several sentences, each of which contains one or more spelling and/or punctuation (grammar) mistakes. Your program should find all the sentences, print them out, and then for each sentence, indicate in a newline after each word exactly how you would correct each mistake. <n><n>For example:<n><n>This would go under "Punctuation: Wrong word(s) use." <n><n>Example sentence: "I have seen a need for an invention like this for some time, although it hasnt been until i <n>read the book (in 1482) i <n>thought the idea could actually work..."<n><n>Here is how you need to change it: <n>1. Put a comma after "book."<n><n>2. Add "and" to "i thought."<n><n>Your program must take in a string of text and print the output after each word of each sentence in standard output. The sentences can also have punctuation errors.<n><n>The input sentence will always start with \"There is one or more mistakes in the following:\" with the input of sentences underneath.<n><n>For example: There is one or more mistakes on the following sentences:"I have seen a need of an invention like this some time, although it hasn't been until i read the book (in 2018) i thought the idea could work"."I have seen a need but until I read the book, I <n>didn't know that I would really love the idea."<n><n>--- Part Three ---<n><n>Write a program that takes words from standard input.  The program will replace a specific first letter of each word (given in the code and standard input) with a new letter in the code, and standard input otherwise.  This is the only modification done to the words.  The words will be the same order as when giving them in
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:I'm at a restaurant ans want a glass of milk, how do I find out if they serve that? Choices:  A: accompaniment to meal B: waitress C: cafeteria D: home E: menu<n>Output:		C: cafeter<n><n>Input:What do I do if I need to call back to the restaurant?<n><n>Choices: A: call me B: call manager C: call him D: call boss E: calling back<n>Output: D: calling back<n><n>Input: The staff need the information so they can put it into the computer and use it to do all the food orders. Choices: A: food order B: write down the information and enter it by hand C: data entry D: computer E: data base<n>Output: B: write down the info. and enter it by hand<n><n>### My code<n>```python<n>A,B,C,D,E,F,X,G,H,I,J,O,P = range (0,11)<n><n>def a(x, y):<n>    if y == A:return None<n>    if x > 10:return False<n>else:return x+y<n>    <n>def b(x):<n>    return x+5 if x == A else x<n><n>def c(z):<n>    if x in z:return ''<n><n>def d(g, i):<n>    if i in g:return (i, g)<n>    else:return (i, set())<n><n>def e(y):<n>    if y[0]!= E:return y[0]<n><n>def f(i, j, h, k):<n>    print 'Answer is: ', [i for j in k if j+h == i]<n>    return [i for j in  k if j+h[1] == i]<n><n>if __name__=='__main__':<n>    #print f<n>for i in range (0,20):<n>    if int(f(a(*i))[0]) == int(f(b(*i))[0]):<n>        print f(a(*i))<n>

[Return the index at which a given substring is found in a given string](./string_indexes2.pdf)<n><n>2. [Checks if a given string contains substring](./string_index.pdf)<n>### Instruction:Write the first function which will replace a substring with a given character.<n><n>Input: "Hello, My name is Santosh."<n>Substring : Santosh<n>Character to replace : 9<n>Output: "Hello, My namN is SanThoN."<n><n>1. [Substring](./sub_string.pdf)<n>2. [Substring replacement](./string_replacement.pdf)<n>## Instruction:<n>* Write the program which checks if the number entered by the user is a palindrome or not. If yes, print “palindrome” else print “not palindrome”.<n><n>1. [Palindrome](./palindrome.pdf)<n>## Input: Given three numbers, return the greatest number<n><n>Input: 1,2,4<n>Output: 4 <n><n>```c<n>int compare(const void *a, const void *b){ <n>  if(*(int*)a > *(int*)b) return 1; else return -1;<n>}<n>int main(){<n>  int* a = malloc(sizeof(int));<n>  a[0] = 4; a[1] = 2; a[2] = 1; <n>  qsort(a, a[0] + 1, sizeof(int), compare); <n>  return 0;<n>}<n>```<n><n>## Input: Given 4 numbers, return the greatest and the smallest numbers<n><n>Input: 4,3,3,2<n>Output: 4,3<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Bill did not abandon the fight, but did what to the enemy? Choices:  A: arrogate B: retain C: embrace D: smile E: engage<n>Output:		D: smile<n><n>Input: You needn't be so polite. Choices:  A. You can B. It is very C. This is OK. D. I can't. E. It is just me.<n>Output:B. It is very<n><n>Input: Do you know him? It is he. Choices:  C: No A: Yes B: He D: She E: We<n>Output: B: He<n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/python3<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-<n><n>from itertools import islice<n>from operator import ior, xor<n><n>def main():<n>    ans_1 = [chr(ord('a') + b) for b in range(26)][:-1] # a-z<n>    ans_2 = [chr(ord(c) + b) for c, b in zip(ans_1, range(1, 4))][:-1] # aa-bx, but not ia-iz etc.<n>    ans_3 = [chr(x + ord(c)) for x, c in zip(ans_2, range(26))] # xz-bz, but no iaa-iz etc.<n><n>    ans_4 = ''.join([chr(i + 1) for i<n>                     in islice(range(ord(ans_3[0]), ord(ans_3[1])), 2)])<n>    ans_5 = ''.join([ans_4[a:b] + ans_1[c:d] for a, b, c, d in<n>                      ior(ans_4, ans_1, xor(ans_4[::-1], ans_1[::-1]))])<n><n>    for i in ans_5:<n>        if (i == "d" or i == "o" or i == "w" or i == "y"): i = "o"<n>        print(i)<n><n>a = ord("a")<n>ans = []<n>chars = {}<n>char_map_1 = {}<n>char_char_1 = {}<n>for c in ['a'..'z' if a else 'A'..'Z']:<n>    char_map_1[c] = ans #
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where would you find people gathered near liquid in a workplace? Choices:  A: water cooler B: opera C: hospital D: hockey game E: beach<n>Output:		E: beach<n><n>Input:When you were in the bathroom, did you see any interesting smells? Choices: A: stinky B: sweet smell C: none D: musty E: good smell<n>Output: A: stink<n><n>Input: I want to look in your drawer and see what you got for lunch.Choices:   A: I don't have anything B: I have lunch C: nothing D: I have a sandwich E: I have cookies<n>Output: I have nothing<n><n>Input:Do you have a tenth cup? Choices:  None of the above<n>Output: There is no tenth cup<n>"""<n><n><n>import time<n>import queue<n>import sys<n><n>class Robot():<n>    def __init__(self, input):<n>        # print('input = ', input[3])<n>        self.get_input = input[3][1][2]<n><n>        if self.get_input:<n>            self.get_input.append(time.ctime())<n>            self.get = (time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', self.get_input))<n>        else:<n>            self.no_input = (time.strptime(self.get, '%Y-%m-%d'))<n><n><n>class Data():<n>    def __int__(self, input, n):<n>        self.input = input<n>        self.n = n<n><n>class Engine():<n>    def __iter__(self):<n>        return self<n><n>    def next(self):<n>        global queue1<n>        global queue2<n>        while True:<n>            if self.f:<n>                queue2.put(Robot(self))<n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    n = 20<n><n>    for i in range(9):<n>        queue1.put(None)<n>    t = list(queue1)<n>    t.sort()<n>    print(t)<n><n>    print('Begin Engine!')<n>    engine = Engine()<n>    while len(queue2) < n:<n>        e = engine.next()<n>        d = queue.get(1)<n>        if d is None:<n>            print('End of queue')<n>        elif d == None:<n>            queue.put(Data

(If none of the above is correct)<n><n>## Instruction:Write python code to solve this problem<n><n>import sys<n>python_version = sys.version<n>print("python version is {0}\n".format(python_version))<n># Python 3.6.9 (default, Dec 7 2020, 18:17:17) <n><n># [Answer] python3.6<n><n>### Codility tutorial<n>https://blog.codingninjas.com/python-data-science-and-machine-learning-with-codingninjas/top-5-data-science/<n><n>### Question: Python <n><n>![](/img/python_tutorial_1.png)<n>https://www.tutorialspoint.com/python/index.htm<n>https://www.python.org/<n><n>https://www.pythontutds.com<n>https://www.w3schools.com/python<n><n><n>###  Instruction:Write python data to solve this problem.<n><n># Important:<n>print(python_version) # Version of the Python<n>print(sys.path)<n><n># Printing the System Path<n>import sys<n>print(sys.platform)<n><n><n>import string<n>import datetime<n>import math<n>import random<n>class Random:<n><n>    def __init__(self):<n>        self.int = [ord(i) for i in string.ascii_letters]<n><n>    def int_random(self):<n>        return random.randrange(*self.int) + 1<n><n>    def str_random(self): #return lower and upper case<n>        res = random.choice([a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, j, k, l]) #letter<n>        length = int(math.random() * 3 + 3) #length<n>        return chr(res) * length<n><n><n><n>def test_string_random(data):<n>    i = 0<n>    res = ''<n>    while i < len(data):<n>        res += Random().str_random()<n>        i += 1<n>    return res<n><n>

Hence I could lead to be 'iaq' and I could be 'lq'. So, there are lots of variations that could fit in 'I', for example in the given example there are 6 possible words that we can construct with the given input 'I'. I'll construct all the possible words from each input and then use the 'Naive Bayes' classifier to predict whether the input is acceptable or not acceptable. Because 'Naive Bayes', it is quite fast and very efficient for classification problems.<n><n>Here I have tried to implement it in Python. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where can you find a place to eat and places to buy items of many different kinds? Choices:  A: city B: downtown C: own house D: bar E: shopping center<n>Output:		A: city  <n><n>Input: What could be bought with gold coins in days gone by? Choices: A: silver coins B: nickles C: plastic coins D: copper coins E: paper coins<n>Output: A: silver coints<n><n>Input: When it's cold outside, what do you do? Choices: A) Burn B) Throw C) Pull D) Clean E) Clean off<n>Output: D) Clean off<n><n>Input: <n>Choices: A) When it's cold B) When it's not C) When you D) When not  <n><n>Output: D) When not<n><n>Input: What time is it? Choices: A clock B: watch<n>Output: A: clock<n><n>Input: What are cobwebs? Choices: A spiders home B: a house<n>Output: A: a house<n><n>Input: Where does the rain come from? Choices: A. The ground B: The tree C: The clouds D: from the sky E: Heaven<n>Output: B: The trees<n><n><n>### Solution<n><n>#### Method 1: Recursion<n><n>```js<n>function machine() {<n>    if (this == 'car') {<n>        return;<n>    }<n>    this = this.toLowerCase();<n>    if (this!= 'car'){<n>      this = machine(this);<n>    }<n>    console.log(this);<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Discussion - Methods<n><n>Recursion is used to make functions. You can define as many levels of parameters in methods that you want but most of the time you should try to simplify problems.<n><n>A recursion function is called when its object is a number. In our case, `this` is a number. `this.toLowerCase` takes a number and returns the number after applying the function on all its characters in lower case.<n><n>For example:<n><n>**`machine('car')` returns 'a'`**<n><n>**`machine(5)` returns [string 5]`<n><n>**`machine` takes in a numerical argument in the start so our base case does not need a return statement.**<n><n>### Question:<n><n>What type of object is `this` (i.e. is this a number, a string, or else)? **Answer

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:There aren't many anemone in what glove-shaped state? Choices:  A: michigan B: lake C: tide pool D: nursery E: atlantic ocean<n>Output:		A: michigan<n>-----<n><n>#### Example Python 2<n>```py<n>from collections import Counter # Count<n><n>answers = Counter('An old lady from Birmingham had a son called Edward, who's an engineer in Scotland but he works for a German firm at the moment. He's an awfully nice fellow. I don't like most Germans, I like Edward all right and I'm glad to get letters from him. They say there's plenty of room in Scotland and the living's cheap — so we may all go live with Ed. He makes a point of sending me his photographs, but I don't get letters from anyone else at all. We never mention politics or religion or anything of that kind, but we always say "Love, Gran" in the letter, I always put "Love, Grandpa".") # 'Son' appears 14 times<n><n>i = 0<n>while i < len(answers):<n>    while answers[i] = "who" and answers[i + 1] = "is" and answers[i - 1] = "an" and answers[i] == int(answers[i + 2]):<n>        i += 3<n>    else:<n>        i += 1<n><n>print(answers[i])<n>```<n><n>#### Example Python+<n>```py<n>from typing_extensions import List<n>from collections import Couter<n><n>answers = input("Enter the string")..trim() # Splits the string into pieces by spaces, removes the white spaces before and after the string<n><n>counter = Counter(answers.split())<n><n>for x in counter:<n>    print(f"{x} = \'{counter[x]}\'")<n>```<n><n>#### 🔔 Discussion Board:<n>[Blog](https://yuanyou.dev/2019-09-05-py/python-practice-answer-for-the-riddle/solution/sol1.html) | [Issue](https://github.com/yuanyouyong/sol-dev/issues/153) | [Riddle](https://github.github.io/riddle.python)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Society cannot exist without numbers.   They only rise up in what sort of spaces? Choices:  A: population B: populated area C: create government D: group of people E: make person sick<n>Output:		C: create government<n><n>Input: Is your head hurting? Choices:  B: brain A: body C: shoulder D: head E: face<n>Output: A: body<n><n>Input: The world is not going fast. Choices:  A"slow moving"B"is fast"C"moving slowly"D"has moved fast"E"very fast"<n>Output: C: moving slowly<n><n>Instruction:Answer the following questions:<n><n>1. Do you think you are better than them?<n>2. Are you happy to help them in their work?<n><n>Input: I cannot wait for the summer to end. Choices:  B"summer season"A"summer holiday"C"my family is going to have a family holiday"D"summer vacation"E"we are going on a summer holiday"<n>Output: A: summer holiday<n><n>Input:How much did you earn last month? Choices:  D"$500"B"$800"A"$1000"C"$200"E"$100"<n>Output: C"$200<n><n>1. 50/2.16=?<n>2. 4.45*2.16=<n><n>```python<n>def main():<n>    answer = {}<n>    answer['question'] = 1<n>    answer['question2'] = 0<n><n>    while True:<n>        answer = [question(answer), number(answer)]<n>        if answer['question'] == '1':<n>            break<n>    print(answer)<n><n><n>def question(answer):<n>    print('Choose a response.') <n>    question2=0<n>    print('Enter Q1: ')<n>    print('A1'<n>    for choice in range(1,6):<n>        print(' '+str(choice),end=' ')<n>    question=input().strip()<n>    if question == 'A1':<n>        answer['answer'] = 1<n>        answer['question2']=1<n>        question2=1<n>        print('Enter Q2: ')<n>        print('A2'<n>        for choice1 in range(1,5):<n>            print(' '+str((choice1 + 1)),end=' ')<n>        print(' '+'C

Where would a crane be used? Choices:  C: A hospital D: An airport E: A factory F: A city<n>Output: B: A port<n><n>Input: Who is the richest person in the world? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:How does getting paid feel? Choices:  A: income tax B: satisfaction C: sorrow D: ocean E: bill collectors to happy<n>Output:		E: bill collectors<n><n>Input: What was the man's name? Choices:  a: A Man b: Anything c: B Man d: A Person e: He's so annoying<n>Output: e: He's So Annoying<n>\end{code}<n><n>\begin{pre}<n><n>#!/usr/bin/env python2<n>'''This is the file for testing for a code project'''<n>import sys<n><n>def word(line, choices):<n><n>    while True:<n>        if len(choices) == line.count(' '):<n>            return choices.index(line.split(' ')[0])<n>        i = 0<n>        for elem in choices:<n>            if i == len(choices) - 1:<n>                 return i<n>            i += 1<n>            if line.split(' ')[i] == elem:<n>                break<n><n>word('I\'m really really what?,', ['A: angry', 'B: sad', 'C: happy', 'D: angry and bored'])<n><n>\end{pre}<n><n>I expect to see the following:<n>\begin{itemize}<n>\item The machine was very intricacy, it was quite an......<n>\item Where do you get petroleum.<n>\item How does getting paid feel.<n>\item What was the man'a name?<n>\end{itemize}<n><n>Comment: What is the expected input, output and error messages?<n><n>Comment: what is the question - the first sentence seems to be code<n><n>Comment: I updated the post to show my attempt and expected output.<n><n>Comment: It was quite an.....<n><n>Answer: I think there are two things<n>1) your while will not repeat and there is no need of index so return False from there and then use return from main program<n>2) get word index if count is less then 2 then return -1.<n>Check below code<n><n>\begin{code}<n>from collections import defaultdict<n><n>a=defaultdict(x)<n>x=int(input())<n>a[x].append(input())<n>for n in a:<n>    if len(a[n])>2:<n>        print n,a[n]<n>    else :<n>        print "None word found "<n>\end{code}.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:The person was looking up airline and hotel prices, what was he looking to do? Choices:  A: control computer B: separate things C: go on vacation D: cross street E: go out<n>Output:		D: go out<n><n>Input: He was taking apart the car what was he doing? Choices:  V: change the radio B: change the engine C: wash the seats D: check the oil E: take apart<n>Output: V: change the radio<n><n>Input: The doctor was examining the patient what was he examining him for? Choices:  F: head cold, B: sickness, C: sickness, D: sickness, E: sickness<n>Output: E: sickness<n><n>Input: The car was being worked on in the garage what was being repaired? Choices:  T: heater, B: windshield wipers, C: car, D: radio, E: brake lights<n>Output: C: car<n>#!/usr/bin/python<n><n>import re<n><n># Define dictionary variables for all the possible answers to the questions<n># that we come across in the problem<n>options = {<n>"burn hot" : "A",<n>"wash dishes" : "E",<n>"control computer" : "B",<n>"take apart" : "V",<n>"examining" : "F",<n>"check the oil" : "E","repair" : "D"}<n><n># Define the functions that will be used by the script<n>def replace_accents (s):<n>    import unicodedata<n>    return unicodedata.normalize('NFC', s).encode('ASCII')<n><n># Replace punctuation and spaces by a question mark<n>def remove_spaces (s):<n>    return s.translate(None,'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz').lower()<n>def replace_puns (s):<n>    s = remove_spaces(s)<n>    return s.split(' ')[0]<n><n>def replace_punc_s (s):<n>    print s.replace([",',",'"',"'",".","?",'"''"],'')<n><n>questions = ['The machine was very intricate','Where do you get petrol','The person was looking up ','He was taking apart the car ','The doctor was examining the ']<n><n># Functions to handle the question marks for answers<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:What appliance uses water and soap? Choices:  A: washing machine B: space shuttle C: blender D: disneyland E: surface of earth<n>Output:		C: blender<n><n>Input: Who will eat the fish? Choices:  a: dog b: man c: fish d: mouse e: cow<n>Output:  a: dog<n><n>### Instruction:Implement the algorithm<n>#### My algorithm:<n>``` Python<n>def f(str):<n>    m = 1<n>    while len(str)==m:<n>        for i in range(1,m+1):<n>            if str.find(chr(i))==-1:<n>                return 1<n>        else:<n>            m=m+1<n>    return 2<n>```<n><n>### Instructins: 2nd algorithm<n>```Python<n>def algorithm1(str,m):<n>    i,m+1<n>    m = 0<n>    while len(s)==1+i-1:<n>        for j in range(32,32+m,1):<n>            if s.startswith(chr(j)):<n>                m = m + 1<n>                return j <n>```<n><n>## Instructions: Final Result<n>```Python<n>def f(s):<n>    m = ord(s[0])<n>    i = 1<n><n>    while len(m)==i-1:<n>            for j in range(ord(s[1]),ord(s[1])+m,1): #I changed the for to range(i+1,4), because the list starts with 0<n>                if s.startswith("."):<n>                    i = i+1<n>                else:<n>                    i = m<n>                    break<n>            m = (ord(s[0]))<n>```    <n>### Link:My final implementation<n><n>[Code on GitHub](https://github.com/LangMind/LangMindBot/blob/master/Coding/Python%20Project%201%20-%20Bring%20Up%20The%20Fish%20-Challenge.py)<n><n>[My Github profile](https://github.codelangmind.com/profile)<n><n>### References<n>- [https://github.com/@shivangipuja/Tips-to-Cracking-Google-Leveling](https://github.blog/2020-05

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:What does a virus primarily do to a person? Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n>Output:		Choices:B reproduce<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>First question's choice C and E was ruled out, as the machine was a tool not an implement. As the choice are all a word which can mean a box,  the correct answer was apparatus: Answer: B: apparatus.<n>The second question's choice B and D were ruled out as petrol is something you put in a car. The answer was therefore a gas station: Answer D: gas station.<n>The third question's choice C should be mutating, as A and E were ruled out (as the virus was not eating it's food, it was reproducing). The choice mutate was therefore true: Answer B: reproduce.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>import re<n>from typing import List<n><n>def solution(word: List[str], answer_list: List[str]) -> List[str]:<n>    return [key in answer_list for key in word if re.search(r"^%s$" % key, word)]<n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    assert str(solution(["box", "apparatus", "appliance", "implement"], ["box", "apparent", "apparatus"])) == '[1, 2]'<n>    assert str(<n>        solution(["petrol", "gasoline", "fueltank", "car"], ["burnhot", "fueltank", "gas"])) == '[0, 1, 2, 0, 2]' <n>    assert str( <n>            solution(["virus", "vaccine", "mutate", "mistake", "makefood"], ["virus", "vacine", "makefood", "mistake" ])) == "[]"

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:How can you get in shape if there is no land nearby? Choices:  A: swim B: jog C: excercise D: work out E: rock climb<n>Output:		A: swim<n><n>Input:You should not waste your time doing manual labor if you have a robot. Choices:  A. burn hot B. manual labor C. burn hot D. car E. gas station<n>Output:A: burn hot<n><n>Input: Is there a grocery store nearby? Choices: A: burn hot B. gas station C. car D. petrol E. excercise<n>Output: B: gas station<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>```php<n>$input = [<n>    ['a', 'apparatus'],<n>    ['b', 'pantograph'],<n>    ['c', 'apparatus']<n>];<n><n>/**<n> * @param integer $n<n> * @param array $a<n> * @return string<n> */<n>function question($n, $a) {<n>    $n = str_pad($n, 3, '0', STR_PAD_LEFT);<n>    return''. ($n + '').''. $a[rand(0, sizeof($a)-1)]. '.' ;<n>}<n><n>echo join(question(1, $input), "\n");<n>```

Find the 5th intersection between their tracks in the same period.<n><n>```python<n>import sys<n>sys.path.append('../')<n>from sklearn import cross_validation<n>from sklearn.model_selection import ShuffleSplit<n>import pandas as pd<n>import numpy as np<n>import matplotlib.pyplot as plt<n>import matplotlib.ticker as ticker<n><n>df = pd.read_csv('airplanes.txt')<n>```<n>We can compute the mean difference between the first 100 intersections and the last 100 intersessions using linear model:<n>```python<n>from scipy.stats import linregress<n>import seaborn as sns<n>sns.set(context="paper")<n>g = sns.PairGrid(df['Intersections'], df['Time'], color ='skyblue')<n>g.despine()<n>g.map(plt.line, kind="kde", ax=g.ax)<n>g.map(sns.kdeplot, ax=g.ax, color='skyblue', shade=True)<n>plt.title("The average distance between the first 110 and last 110 intersections")<n>plt.xlabel('Time')<n>plt.ylabel('Intersections')<n>plt.legend()<n>plt.tick_params(axis = 'both', which ='minor', bottom = None, top = None)<n>plt.xlim(g.ax._get_ylim())<n>plt.show()<n>```<n>![plot](plot.png)<n><p align="center"><n></p><n><n><n>We can compute the average difference between the first 30

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where do almost all people live? Choices:  A: football stadium B: apartment C: surface of earth D: car show E: house<n>Output:		E: house<n>[Instruction: ](https://app.codechef.com/problems/TUBETI6/submissions)<n>-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n>    function get_choice(choices, idx, ans):<n>          if idx == 1:<n>        return true<n>              else:<n>        return false<n>      function findChoice(ans, id):<n>                ans = choices[0]<n>                for i in range(0,n):<n>                  if findChoice(ans,i):<n>            return i<n>        <n>function check(choices, ans):<n>      c = get_choice(choice, 0, ans)<n>      if not c:<n>        return -1<n>      return 0<n><n>ans = list("A B C D E ")<n>ans[0] = ans[ans.index(" ")]<n>n = len(ans)<n># for i in range(n):<n>#   ans[i]=str(int(ans[i])+1)<n><n>choices = list(range(1,100+1))<n><n>ans = check(choices, str(ans[0]))<n>    <n>if (ans == -1):<n>print('no')<n>elif ans == 0:<n>print('exampt')<n>else:<n>print('incorrect')<n><n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where in a town would you put your shed? Choices:  A: next to the house B: keeping things in C: backyard D: farm yard E: ranch<n>Output:		E: ranch<n><n>Input:What is the opposite of a pig? Choices:  a: fish b: pig c: pork d: cow e: ham<n>Output: e: ham<n><n># 3. Write a function name findThat(str) which takes as parameters a string, that returns the string which the given string is the opposite of.<n><n>## Expected output<n><n>```<n>findThat('pig') => ham<n>findThat('appliance') => apparatus<n>findThat('petrol') => fuel<n>findThat('gas station') => burn<n>findThat('burn hot') => car<n>findThat('house') => home<n>```<n><n>## Algorithm<n><n>1. Input the received string.<n>2. Create a variable `i` to help the search.<n>3. Look from right to left, each character, until the first letter match `i`.<n>4. Create a variable `j`, if the letters match move to next loop.<n>5. If letters do not match, set the value of `findThat` to the value of `i`, and set value of `j` to the new value of `i`.<n><n># 4. Write a function name isOpposite(a, b) which takes as parameters two strings and returns the string whose letters are in reverse order of the other string.<n><n>## Examples<n><n>```<n>isOpposite('pig', 'ham') => 'ham'<n>isOpposites('home','house') => 'ouse'<n>isOpposes('car','burn') => 'burn'<n>isOpposses('keeing','things') => 'ngs'<n>isOpponist('fuel' - 'car') => 'car'<n>```<n><n>## Expected Output<n><n>```<n>isThereApparatusInYourHome() => thir home apparatus is what<n>```<n><n>## Draft Code<n><n>## 1. Write a function name doIt(str, arr) which takes as parameters string and array. A character in the string matches with an index of array if the character is one of the four first characters. The function output a string if there is any match in the array. If not, output a blank string.<n><n>### Example<n><n>```<n>doIt('dad', ['d', 'a', 'a', 't'])
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? In this course we shall teach the machine rules to convert an English utterance into English text. Some of these rules will seem bizarre (to a human). These rules are bizarre only in the sense that many human beings (and even some computers) have trouble understanding the rules.<n><u>Input: "Are you busy"</u><n><u>Output: "Not at all"</u><n><n>### Question: <n><u>Input "What's your name"</u><n>What is the machine output?<n>##### Hint: Look at the previous examples above and see if you can reason this one on your own first. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  *A: classroom *B: synagogue *C: bathroom *D: front porch *E: grocery store Output: E: grocery...<n><n>### Solution:<n>#!/usr/bin/python2.7<n>#include<iostream><n>#include<algorithm><n>#include<string><n>#include<sstream><n><n>using namespace std;<n><n>class Machine{<n><n>	private:<n><n>		char* c;<n><n>	public:<n><n>		Machine(char* init_c){c=new char[4];strcpy(c,"");}<n>		~Machine(){delete[]c;}<n><n>		void read(int count){<n>			for(int i=0;i<=count;i++){cin.get(c[i]);}<n>		}<n><n>		void getline(){<n>			read(32);<n>		}<n>};<n><n>int main() {<n><n>	int n=2, q=1, k=0;<n>	Machine a;<n>	a.read(n);<n>	while(a.c[k]!='\0'){if((a.c[k]+n)*10>k){cout<<"Implement"<<endl;}}<n>	k++;for(int i=k;i<n;i++){if(a.c[i]=='D'&&i>k){cout<< "Apparatus"<<endl;}}for(int i=n-1;i>=0;i--){if(a.c[(i)+k]=='D'||i<k+1){cout<< "Implement"<<endl<<endl;break;}}<n><n>	getline();			getline();<n>	for(int i =0;i<q;i++) {<n>		int n=3,m=0;<n>		Machine b;<n>		b.read(n);			b.read('D');<n><n>		getline();	<n>		for(;m<n;m++){<n>			cout<< b.c[m] <<" " << (b.c[m]+m)*10%10

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where is the strategic gold reserve in the U.S.? Choices:  A: jewelery B: fort knox C: church D: jewelry store E: treasure chest<n>Output:		E: treasure chests<n><n>Input: How many words were there in Shakespeare's sonnets? Choices: 	A: thirty seven B: fifty five C: one hundred and eight D: four seventeen E: two thousand and twenty-one<n><n>Output: D: four seventeen<n><n>Input: Do you know how the weather is? Choices: <n>A: yes B: no C: yes D: very good E: very bad<n>Output: A: yes<n><n>Input:What did Jesus say before he said Hallelujah? Choices: "A: yes B: No" Out: A: Yes<n><n>### Your answer:<n>The machine was quite an wash dishes.<n><n><n><n>### Solution:<n>There are three different kinds of words. Adjectives (adjective1), nouns (noun1)and verbs (verb1). Therefore to tell if "where do you get petrol?" should be answered with "burn hot", "burn hot" should have the same number of letters, have the same vowel, have the same syllables or have more than two syllables <n><n><n>### Submission:<n>You must submit your solution by clicking the `+` button on the menu bar, or the green button on the navigation bar.<n><n><h4>Refer to the file `Solved Questions.txt`.</h4><n><n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Who sits at the center table at a receeption? Choices:  A: restorand B: wedding party C: church basement D: corridor E: restaurant<n>Output:		B: wedding party<n><n>Input:You may choose a single option from A-E Choices:  A:"The sky is blue" B:"Blue is the sky" C:"A bright blue sky" D:"The blue sky" E:"A very bright sky"<n>Output: C:"A bright blue"<n><n># Instructions:<n>Implement a function f that accepts a single string "S" and returns the first word. The string should be a sentence only and must start with a capital letter.<n><n>if S is just one word, return the capitalized word.<n>If S has more than one word, return the first word.<n><n>Examples:<n>f("Hello world") = "Hello"<n>f("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog") = "The"<n><n># Implementation:<n>def f(s):<n>    s = s.split() # split a sentence into a list of tokens<n>    return s[0] # if s was a single word, return it.<n>        <n># Test Example 1<n>f("Hello World")<n>#=> Hello<n><n># Test Example 2:<n>f("The quick Brown Fox jumps over the lazy Dog")<n> #=><n> #=> The<n><n># Test Example:<n>f("The Quick brown Fox jumps over the Lazy dog.")<n># =><n># => The<n><n># Test case:<n>f("11")<n># => Error:<n># TypeError: int() argument must be a string, a bytes-like object or a number, not'str' <n><n># 1. Python3<n>def f(i):<n>    # return i.upper() #return the uppercase letter of the first word<n>    # return i[:1].upper() #return the first and only letter, if the firt word is more than 1 letter, it will return the first letter<n>    if i[:1] == " " #if the first letter is not capitalized, return the word<n>    return i.split(" ")[0].upper() #return first<n>        #if uppercase, return the first uppercase letter<n><n>#2. The main function is a function itself<n>def main(s):<n>    f(s)<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Three quarters of what are covered by the ocean? Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n>Output:		E: river<n><n>Input: What a beautiful car! Choices:  A. black B. beige C. orange D. grey E. yellow<n>Output: C: orange<n><n>The correct answers are: Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.Input: The machine was quite an what?Choices: A: boxB: apparatusC: applianceD: wash dishesE: implementOutput: B: apparat...<n><n>```python<n>def get_instruction():<n>    global str_input,str_output<n>    str_input = input("Input:").title()<n>    str_output = input("Output:")<n><n>def calculate():<n>    if "Instruction" == str_input:<n>        global correct<n>        correct = 0<n>    elif "Choices" == str_input[:3]:<n>        global correct<n><n>        correct = int(input("Choices: "))<n><n>    elif "Choose the right choice" == str_input[2:]:<n>        global correct, correct_output, choices<n>        choices = list(map(str.upper, input("Choices: ").split()))<n>        print("Output:")<n>        if choices == [str_output]:<n>            correct += 1<n>        else:<n>            correct=0<n>    else:<n>        for choices in str_input.split():<n>            if choices.isalpha():<n>                print(choices, end = ":")<n>    input("For next question? ")<n><n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where would you buy a ticket to sit in a room with a lot of chairs facing the same direction? Choices:  A: conference B: theater C: building D: floor E: church<n>Output:		A: conference<n><n>Input:Which is this part connected to? Choices:  B: air A: oil D: computer C: water B: water<n><n><n>```python<n>A="C"<n>B="B"<n>C="E"<n>D="A"<n>E="D"<n>F="C"<n>G="A"<n><n>if A == B:<n>	print("The two machines were similar in function, however, the one on the wall was actually more accurate.\n", end=" ")<n>else:<n>	if C == D:<n>		print("You should have gone to the train station.\n", end="")<n><n>if C == E:<n>	print("You were looking for a chair in the church to sit.\n", end="",)<n><n><n><n>if D == F:<n>	print("They were the same kind of equipment, but the other one was on wheels.\n", end=" ",)<n><n>if D == G:<n>	print("It was a more modern version of the one you wanted.\n", end="\n",)<n>elif D == A:<n>	print("I have no idea.\n", end="\"",)<n>else:<n>	print("Hmm, I don't know.\n", end=" \n",)<n><n>```<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:In war, your primary method is combat, but your goal is to do what? Choices:  A: conquer opponent B: fight enemy C: join army D: kill E: terrible<n>Output:		E: terrible<n><n>#### Explanation:<n><n># 1<n>1. We have to pick out the word that is most similar to the meaning of the question, in our case the word that most resembles 'intricate' would be 'complex' thus our answer to 'A' is correct<n><n># 2<n>2. We have to pick the word that is most dissimilar to the meaning of it, choosing the word 'petrol' is unlikely as the meaning of 'petrol' is a 'fuel for an engine', in contrast, 'gasoline' is what is desired, a 'fuel for a vehicle' thus our answer to' C' is correct<n><n>3. We have to pick what is the opposite of 'terrible', thus the appropriate meaning would be 'fine', thus our answer to 'E' is correct<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Who does the government help with schools? Choices:  A: school children B: parents C: get money D: require to pay taxes E: take money<n>Output:		E: take money<n><n>Input:What do you make with a toaster? Choices:  toast A: a tea B: buttered bread C: food D: a sandwich E: ham<n>Output: D: a sandwich<n><n>Input:Does your TV run off electricity? Choices:  true A: no B: yes C: false D: always E: sometimes<n>Output: F: A, C, D, E <n><n>Input:What colour is the sky? Choices:  blue A: green B: red C: black D: white E: yellow<n>Output:B: red<n><n>Input:You eat food with cutlery? Choices:  yes A: no B: food C: knife d: fork E: cutlery<n>Output: D: fork<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>## Java<n>```<n>boolean answer;<n>String[] choices = {"apparatus", "wash machine", "toaster", "washing", "cooker", "burn hot"}<n>for (String choice: choices){<n>	if (choice.equalsIgnoreCase("burn hot") && machine.equalsIgnoreCase("apparatus")) answer=true; <n>	else if (choice.equalsIgnorecase("burn")&&machine.equalsIgnoreCase("washing")) answer=true;<n>	else if ( choice.equalsIgnoreCase("toaster") && machine.equals("washing machine")) answer=true;	<n>	else if (machine.equalsIgnoreCase ("cooker")) answer=true<n>	else if(machine.equalsIgnoreCase( "washing")) answer = true<n>}<n>System.out.println(false == answer);<n>```<n><n>## C++<n>```<n>bool answer;<n>string class_machine[] = {"apparatus","washing","burn","toaster","wash machine"};<n>for (string choice: class_machine){<n>    if (choice.compare(0,strlen("burn"),"burn hot") == 0 && machine.compare(0, strlen("washing"), "washing") == 0)<n>	{<n>		answer=true;<n>		break;<n>	}<n>	if (choice == "washing machine" && machine.compare(strlen("burning", 3), strlen("wash", 5

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where in Southern Europe would you find many canals? Choices:  A: michigan B: new york C: amsterdam D: venice E: bridge<n>Output:		E: amsterdam<n><n>Input:What animal is a symbol to represent Australia? Choices: 	A: kangaroo B: dingo C: snake D: koala E: emu<n>Output: A: kangaroo<n><n>Input:An elephant which weighs eight hundred kg can stand with ease. When walking it needs only five kilos of pressure on its per square cm. Which of these numbers are the biggest? Choices: 1) 5 kg, 2) five kg, 3) 800 kg, 4) eight hundred kg, 5) 8 kgs.<n>Output: 4) eight hundred<n><n>Solution:<n>```<n>const input = ['the machine was very intricate; it was quite an apparatus',<n>             'where do you get petrol',  <n>             'where in southern europe would you find many canels',<n>             'what animal is a symbol to repersent australia',<n>             'an elephant which weigths eight hundred kg can stant with ease. when walking it needs only five  kg of pressure on its per  square ckm. which of these numbers are the biggest?', <n>             'the man is tall, so he would be able to reach the tallest object in the room. which of these numbers is the tallest in the room? (one,two, three)']<n><n>const output = [<n> 'the machine was very intricated; it was a quite an apparatus',  <n> "you go to the fuel station", <n> 'you can find many canals in southern europe', <n> 'the koala is a symbol of australia',<n> 'the man is the tallest because it was the tallest among elephants', <n> 5]<n><n>const output1 = []<n>const inputArray = []<n><n>output1.push(...output)<n>output.unshift(output1)<n><n>inputArray.push(...input)<n>input.unshift(inputArray)<n><n>const options = []<n>new Option('A', 'A')<n>new Option('I', 'I')<n>new Option('E', 'E')<n>new Option('O', 'O')<n>new Option('N', 'N')<n><n>const optionsArray = []<n>options.unshift(options)<n>optionsArray.push(...options

He tended to be always late but the professor in his classroom was not a patient person. He always asked George to leave the room until he appeared and this was happening for two days in the row. George was worried and had a look at the clock. It was just a few minutes to start the class. He started to run quickly through the corridors of the university building. All his friends were surprised that he was not here. Finally after some minutes he arrived. It was a short time to enter to the class. The professor started to speak loud and clear.<n><n>

Choices:  B: 水面向上 D: 山体一个<n>Output: B: 水面浮动<n><n><n>### Credit: https://leetcode.com/problems/code-golf/<n><n>### Contributing:<n>1. Fork `code-golf` <n>2. Clone your fork `git clone your-fork-name`<n>3. Install project dependencies `npm i`<n>4. Run dev server `npm run build && npm start`<n>5. To contribute, clone/fork the repo to your local machine<n>5. Set up to work on `code-golf/app/index.ts`<n>5. Create a branch `git checkout -b your-branch-name`. This is where you can<n>   develop a feature or fixe some bug(s)<n>5. Make your code change<n>5. Commit your changes<n>5. Check all tests pass on local machine (open `package.json` and look for <n>   `tests: "./index.ts"`?)<n>6. Push to your remote branch `git push origin your-branch-name`<n>7. Open a pull request to merge your change<n>8. When your pull is accepted merge it<n><n>### License:<n>[APACHE 2.0](LICENSE)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:A blowfish lives free. He lives on his own. Where does he live? Choices:  A: fish market B: pet shop C: great outdoors D: river E: little mermaid<n>Output:		A: fish market<n><n>### [Solution](solutions/3-1.py)<n><n>#### 3.1)<n><n>```python<n>def word_in_sentence(words):<n>    print("Input:", words)<n>    print(len(words))<n>    if words == []:<n>        return "Nope."<n>    elif words == ["I"]:<n>        return "Yes."<n>    elif len(words) == 1:<n>        return words[0]<n>    else:<n>        return "Sorry there is only one word, but there are many more words in the sentences."<n><n>def guess_sentence(word, string):<n>    # I do not understand why do we need the following code<n>    words = string.split()<n>    # but I copied it from somewhere, and you know, we're living in the capital of China<n>    # We need to be very respectful to our ancestors, so we can't touch it 🙏.<n><n>    return word_in_sentense(words)<n><n>words = ["I", "the", "the", "a", "you", "you", "them", "them","the", "are", "she"]<n>print("Input:", words,  " ->\n")<n>```<n><n>#### 3-2<n><n>```python<n>class SimpleThing(object):<n>    __slots__ = ['name']<n><n>    def __init__(self, name):<n>        self.name = name<n><n>    def __str__(self):<n>        return self.name<n><n>    def __repr__(self):<n>        """<n>        Just an alternative way to show str method.<n>        """<n>        return self.str<n><n>### This is where it gets tricky<n><n>class ComplicatedThing(SimpleThing):<n>    # We are re-instantiating Class<n>    __slots = ['number']<n><n>    def number(self):<n>        return 1<n><n>p = ComplicatedThing('Peter')<n>print(p)  # Peter<n>```<n><n>### 3-3.<n><n>```python<n># A and B define a struct type of C<n>class C(A, B):...<n>```<n><n>## # # #<n><n>If you're interested in more, here is a list

It will be difficult, be sure.<n><n>It is to determine that you are worthy of the title of a sage.<n><n>We begin.<n>""")<n>input="""<n>1.A box 2.apparatus 3.apparatus 4.gas station 5.in the trees<n>"""<n>while input:<n>    i=input.strip()<n>    if "what" in i or "do" in i or "use" in i:<n>        c=input.split()<n>        count=0<n>        for k in xrange(len(c)):<n>            if count>=3 and not(c[k] in set(["A","B","C","D","E"])):<n>                print("No.")<n>                if c[k]==("use") and c[0]==("petrol"):<n>                    print("This is not a good choice.")<n>                break;<n>            if not(c[k]=="A" and c[k]==c[0] and c[k] in set(['A','B','C','D','E'])):<n>                print("Oops... not a good choice.") <n>                break;<n><n>            print(c[k]+"")<n>        i=""<n>        count=0;<n>        if count<3:<n>            print("That was good!")<n>        continue<n>    input=input.strip()+", ";<n>print("Thank You!")<n>

Choices: A: In the afternoon  <n>Output: B: early in the afternoon<n><n>Input : How often does he play golf? Choices: A : Every week B: three times a week C: Once a week D: Twice a week E: Four times a week<n>Output: C: once a week<n><n>Input: Which is the best golf? Choices:  Y: Westwood Golf Center  <n>Output: N: Westwood golf Center<n><n>Input: What the price of the golf? Choices: Y: five hundred kata <n>Output: N: five hundred yen<n><n>Input: What is the weight of the ball? Choices: Y; ten kilograms E: two kilograms <n>Output: N; 2.3 kilograms<n><n>Input: Where does the ball fall? Choices: Y: on the ground <n>Output: N : on the grass<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: show B: theatre C: hockey game D: movies E: event<n>Output:		D: movies<n><n>Input: Which part of the machine moves faster? Choices: 1 A: blades B: handle C: motor D: wheels E: chain<n>Output: E: chain. <n><n><n>## Solutions:Answer the following multiple choince questions that are similar.<n><n>### Multiple Choise Problems:<n><n><n>#### Question 0<n>The machine was an what? Choices A: box B: aparatus C: appliance dishes E: implement <n><n>Output:<n>```<n>B<n>```<n><n>#### Question 1<n>Where do you get petrol. Choices A: burn hot B C: fuel tank and D: car  a petrol station and E: gas station<n>```<n><n><n>#### Question: 2<n>What sport is the audience loudest at? Chocies A show theatre C: hockey, games and D: movies and E: event<n><n>Output:<n><n>```<n>D<n>```<n><n><n>- [Instinctive Programmer Level 2 Exercise2.cpp](https://github.com/KenShin54/Instinctive-KenShin's-Programmer/blob/master/Instinctive-Programmer-Level2/Instinctive%20Programmer%20Level%202/InstinctiveProgrammerLevel2%20Exercise2.cpp)<n>- [Instinct Level Exercise2](https://github.org/KenShin/Instinctive-Level-2/blob/master/Exercise/Instinct%20Level% 20Exercise%202/Exercise2)<n>- [Instituitive Developer-Programmer Exercise2](/Library/Documents/Library/Documents/Instinctive-Developer's-ProgrammerLevel2/Instinctuative-Developer-Programmer-Level 2/InstinctiveDeveloper%27s%20ProgrammerLevel2/Exercise/Exercize2)<n><n><n><n>[14460852_1411272732136598_3605162051971646537_n.jpg](https://static.pexels.com/photos/1
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:A government seeks what over it's people? Choices:  A: country B: trouble C: city D: sun E: control<n>Output:		D: control<n><n>Input: What is a very big word? Choices: <n>A: word<n>B: word<n>C: word<n>D: a word<n>E: a word<n>Output:C: word<n><n>Input: A man wants to know, what is three plus the sum of ten plus seventy? Choices: <n><n>A: man<n>B: he<n>C: she<n>D: she<n>E: she<n>Output:B:  he<n><n>Input: The person said to the boy. Which door do you like? Choices: 	A: boy<n>B: door<n>C: man<n>D: person<n>E: do<n>Output:D: person<n><n>Input: The man wants to see the boy, he wants to see the man, the man wants to see the car.... ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: drink tea B: thank god C: open eyes D: feel angry E: complete sentence<n>Output:		D: feel<n>***<n>Given a string s of lowercase English letters, determine whether it is a palindrome. A palindrome can be read in both directions, and its mirror image is equal to the original.<n><n>Constraints: 1 <= s.length <= 106<n>Example 1:<n>Input: "aba"<n>Output: true<n>Example 2:<n>Input: "racecar"<n>Output: false<n>Note:<n>You may assume that the string contains only lowercase letters<n><n>###My solution<n><n>I use to do this by brute force, and do not have good ideas.<n><n>My solution is to use [RNN(Recurrent Neural Network)][nn] to do some machine translation for me.<n><n>[nn]:https://github.com/Kaizhu2016/nn<n><n>###My learning<n><n>Learned the how to use tensorflow to solve more hard problems.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:She had a knack for entertaining, everybody told he she had a what? Choices:  A: fun B: talent C: learn about D: intelligence E: recognize<n>Output:		A: fun<n><n>Input:Do you know which side is on top of the car? Choices: A: yes B: no C: it depends D: you are here E: either way<n>Output: D: you are here<n><n>#!/bin/env python<n><n>############## Solution ########<n>#!/bin/python3<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-<n>import csv<n>import os<n>import argparse<n>from collections import defaultdict<n><n># Read data from a file<n>parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()<n>parser.add_argument("-i", "--input", type=str)<n>args = parser.parse_args()<n>data = csv.reader(open(args.input))<n><n># Keep a dictionary to keep track of the answer<n>answers = defaultdict(int)<n><n>for qi,qa in enumerate(data,1):<n><n>    if qi == 1:<n>        answers[qa[0]],_,answers[qa[1]]=qa<n>        break<n><n>    wordA = qa[0]<n>    wordB = qa[1]<n><n>    if wordA == wordB:<n>        answers[wordB] +=1<n><n><n>for qi,val in answers.items():<n>        print(str(qi)+":"+str(val))<n><n><n>###################### Solution ####################<n><n>#!/bin//python3<n># - *- coding: utf- 8 - *-<n>import csv<n>from collections import Counter<n>import os, argparse<n><n>parser = argparse   # Define parser object to read parameters<n>parser.add_arg('-i', '--input', type=str, help='Input path')<n>parser.add_help('-i  (Input Path)')<n>args = parser.parser_args()  # Gets file path<n><n>with open(args.input) as file:<n>    csvFile = csv.reader(file)<n><n># count word occurance<n>word_counter = Counter(csvFile.__next__()[0][0])<n><n># dictionary keys<n>index = []<n><n># dictionary values<n>val = []<n><n>val.append(word_counter.most_common())<n>for key,count in val:<n>    index.append(key)<n>    val.clear()<n><n>for

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices: A: junk B: dust C: shit D: shelf E: rubbish<n>Output: A: junk<n><n>### [source](https://www.programiz.com/python-programming/methods/python/list)<n>### Method 1: In Class<n><n>``` <n># The list method is an in-class method that allows us to retrieve specified elements from a list.<n># In this method, we make use of the index value passed to the in-class method to access the specified elements from a list<n><n>a_list = ['python', 'ruby', 'javascript', 'java', 'php', 'css']<n>first_element = a_list[0]<n>print(first_element)<n>second_element = a_liat[1]<n>print(second_element)<n>```<n>### Method 2: out of Class method<n><n>```<n>b_list = ["A", "B", "C"]<n>print(b_list[0])<n>print(b_liat[3])<n>```<n>### Programing Examples:<n>* Write a Python program that retrieves an element from a list at a specified position using out of Class method.<n><n>   ![](ex1.png)<n>    ```<n>    b_list = ["A","B","C","D"]<n>    a_item = b_list[1]<n>    print(a_item)<n>    ```<n>* Write a Python programme that retrieves an element in a list of words starting with the character "m" using out of Class method<n>    <n>   ![](e1_out.png)<n>   ![](f1_out.png)\<n>    ```<n>    m_words = ["mattress","manchester","mango","mouse"]<n>    a_string = m_words[1]<n>    b_string = m_word[3]<n>    ```<n>    <n>    <n>

Choices:  R: car R: people E: eyes<n>Output: E: eyes<n><n>Input:How do I know?  Choices:  A. You can find out. B. I can check. C. I can call a friend.<n>Output: C. I can call friend<n><n>Input:How is this for you?  Choices: A. For you it’s fine.<n>B. It’s fine for me.<n>C. It’s a bit hard on you. D. I love this!<n>Output: A. It’s fine<n><n>## Difficulty:Easy<n>## Top-down design<n>## Time complexity:O(n)<n>## Space complexity:O(n), use array<n><n>def check_one_sentence_machine(sentence):<n>    for word in sentence:<n>        if word[:2] not in set(['It','Was']):<n>            return 'A: box, B: apparatus, C: appliance, D: wash ditches, E: implement', True<n>        if word[:1] not in set(['a','is','are','was']) and word[-2:][0].isupper() not in set(['I','Gotta','Are','Was']):                <n>            return 'B: apparatus', True<n><n>    return 'B: apparatis', False<n><n>def check_phrase1(phrase):<n>    return 'D: burn hot',phrase=='Where do you get petrol?' or phrase=='How do I know?'<n><n>def check_sent1(sent):<n>    return 'E: speed up',sent=='What is the purpose of a cabin in an airplane?'<n><n>def check1(phrase):        <n>	match = check_phrase1('Where do you get petro') or check_phrase1("How do I know?")<n>    #return match['ans'] if match and check_object1(phrase) else 'Nothing'<n>	print('This match',match,' ',phrase)<n><n>def check2(sen):<n>    answer = check_sent1(sen)<n>    return answer.ans<n>def check3(phrase):<n>	return 'A B and C'.split(',')<n>

E: good night<n>Output: B: good bye<n><n>---------------------------------------------------------------- <n><n>### Your Code<n><n>```python<n>import re<n><n>def answer(string, options):<n>    options = [opt for opt in options if opt in string]<n><n>    num = 0<n>    for opt in choices:<n>        num += 1<n>        if options.count(opt):<n>            print(opt, end=' ')<n>            return<n>    <n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:What past time are people engaged in when they are traveling along liquid? Choices:  A: sail boats B: question authority C: high fives D: share things E: learn from each other<n>Output:		D: high fives<n><n>Input: Why can’t I play with you? Choices: 	A:Because you’re so dumb B: Because you’re not smart enough C:Because you’ve already played with others D:Because your friend has broken the ball E:Because you haven’t learnt to play right.<n>Output: F: Because your friend has broken the football.<n><n>```<n>// CPP Solution<n><n>#include<iostream><n><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main()<n>{<n>    int t;<n>    cin>>t;<n>    while(t--)<n>    {<n>        string machine_inStr,answer;<n>        char question;<n>        cin>>question;<n><n>        switch(question)<n>            {<n>                case 'a': machine_inStr = "box"; break;<n>                case 'b': machine_inStr= "apparatus"; break;<n>                default: machine_inStr = "" ; break;<n>            }<n><n>        cout<<machine_inStr<<endl;<n>        cin>>answer;<n>        if (answer == "apparatus")<n>            {<n>                cout<<"C"<<endl;<n>            }<n>            else<n>                cout<<"A"<<endl;<n>            <n>            <n>    }<n>    return 0;<n>}<n>```<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Before getting a divorce, what did the wife feel who was doing all the work? Choices:  A: harder B: anguish C: bitterness D: tears E: sadness<n>Output:		E: sadness<n><n>Input: How can we use the car without fuel? Choices: A: with a new gear B: with a new tank C: with a fuel additive D: with a new engine E: with fuel<n>Output: D: with a new tank<n><n>Input:Why did the student have a headache? Choices:  L: he had been studying all night long M: he fell off a ladder N: he was studying all night long P: he fell off a bicycle<n>Output: I: N: he was studying <n><n>##### Submission<n><n>``` python<n>data = {<n>    "machine": "a/box",<n>    "petrol": "an/tank",<n>    "divorce": "a/feel",<n>    "car": "w/o/gas"<n>    "student": "he/fell"<n>}<n>```<n><n>#### Answer:<n>``` python<n># This file "python_multiple_choice.py" is executed last and checks for correctness of the output<n><n># You only need to change the 1st line of the file<n><n>correct = []<n>for key, value in data.items():<n>    correct.append(key + ": " + value)<n>```<n><n>#### How it works<n><n>* Importing the input from "input.txt" into data variable.<n>* Looping through correct variable of the user, and appending the correct answers to the variable.<n>* Importing the correct variable to a file "correct.txt"<n><n>---<n><n>### Instruction:Write the correct answers to the following multiple choice questions in the file "correct.txt".Use only spaces for new line.<n><n>Output:<n><n>The computer was quite an? Choices: A. box B. apparatus C. appliance D. wash dishes E. implement<n>The gas station is for getting the car? Choices: A burning hot B fuel tank C burning hot D car E gas station<n>The wife felt who was doing all the? Choices: A harder B anguish C bitterness D tears E sadness<n>What do we use the car without? Choices: A with a new gear and a new tank B with a new gear, fuel tank C with a fuel additive, a new tank D a new gear, a fuel additive and a

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Sitting to close while watching TV can cause what sort of pain? Choices:  A: brain problems B: laziness C: get fat D: headache E: laughter<n>Output:		E: laughter<n><n>Input: How old are you today? Choices: A: 12 months B: 12 years C: 12 days D: 12 decades E: 12 hours<n>Output: A: 1 year<n><n>Given a string "A very intricate apparatus, I must say!".<n><n>* Write the code to determine and return the sentence that has the greatest similarity to the given sentence.<n><n>### Output:<n>```<n>The machine was very intricate<n>```<n>### Instruction<n>We will implement a string distance formula. We have two strings and we need to find the distance between them on the basis of letters. We first convert the strings to lists containing letters as values and then calculate the Hamming distance (distances in strings) between the two lists. Using this distance we will need to find the one that is closer in terms of distance.<n><n>```python<n>def get_closest_string(s1, s2):<n>	return np.argmin([min(d,d2) for (d, d2) in zip(list(s1), list(s2))])<n>```<n><n>### Test Case 1<n>```<n>get_closest_string('A very intricate apparus', 'A very intricate apparaus' )# 5<n>get_closest( 'Daily, 545pm is happy hour at Cheers.', 'Dally, 545 pm is happy hour at Cheers.','')#3<n>get_closest('A very intricate  apparatus,  I must say.','A very intricate  aparatus, I must say.','')#4<n>get_closest("This is all very bizarre.", "'This is all very bizzare."','')#3<n>```<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:What does sex often make happen in people? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where would there be many people sitting in chair and listening to religious speech? Choices:  A: auditorium B: office C: synagogue D: confession E: church<n>Output:		E: church<n><n>Input:In which country you can hear banging language all around in every city on the streets? Choices:  i. A: Spain B. Germany ii. A: Italy iii. France B. England C. United States D. China<n>Output:D. China<n><n># Solution:<n>  import re<n>  import sys<n>  import ply.lex as lex<n>  import ply import ply.yacc as yacc<n><n>  token_tables = re.compile('[\w]+', re.IGNORECASE)<n>  to_int = lambda x: int(x) if x.isdigit() else 0<n><n>  to_float = float<n><n>  # lexer takes one argument,<n>  # which is the string that will be lexer.<n>  def tokenize(s):<n>    lex.input(s)<n><n>    for t in lex.tokens():<n>      yield t<n><n>  # yaccs takes one argument, a grammar in.l<n>  def compile(l):<n>    yacc.yacc(l, tokenize)<n><n>  def main():<n><n>    # first function tokenize and other is compile<n>    # pass lexer into it<n><n>    # lexer will give return type string and this result will be passed to compile and<n>    ###<n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    main()<n><n>    ###<n><n><n><n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:What do humans do when in a race? Choices:  A: lay eggs B: eat fruit C: wrestle D: compete with each other E: draw pictures<n>Output:		D: compete with other<n><n>Input: Is it a bird or a plane? Choices: A: a plane B: a bird C: a plane D: a bird E: a plane<n>Output: A: a plane<n><n>Input: There are so many different kinds of food in here. Choices:  A" apples B: apples C: mango D: rice E: bread<n>Output: A: apples<n><n>Input: She is not a cook, she is a what? Choices: A" waitress B: waitress C: nurse D: doctor E: waitress<n>Output: E: waitress<n><n>Input: Did you finish the project? Choices:  " A: yes B: no C: maybe D: maybe E: yes<n>Output: E: yes<n><n>Input: I heard you are going to buy what? Choices: " A: a dog B: a rabbit C: rabbit D: dog Rabbit<n>Output: D: dog<n><n>#### My Solution:<n>    import java.util.Scanner;<n>    class MCQ<n>    {<n>        public static void main(String args[])<n>        {<n>        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);<n>        String input, output;<n>        int answer = 0, i = 0;<n>        System.out.print("Enter A B C D E which represents the letters A B C D E : ");<n>        input = sc.nextLine();<n>        if (input.equals("A:"))<n>        {<n>            System.out.print("\nEnter what word represents the letters A B :\n");<n>            output = sc.nextLine().toUpperCase(); //get the uppercase as string variable<n>            answer = (output.startsWith("A") && output.endsWith("A"));<n>            while(i++!= 3)<n>            {<n>                System.out.print(answer + " : " + output + "\n");<n><n>                if (answer == false)<n>                {<n>                    break;<n>                }<n>                if (answer!= true)<n>                {<n>                System.exit(1);<n>                }<n>            }<n>        }<n>        }<n>    }<n><n>#### My Solution 2:<n><n>import java.util.Scannor;<n>import java.util.*;<n><n>public class MCQ<n>{<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:Where might you have cake with your ice cream? Choices:  A: earth B: movie C: party D: served cold E: freezer<n>Output:		E: freezer<n><n><n>### Instruction:Write pseudocode for code solution.<n><n>```<n>    public static void main(String[] args)<n>    {<n>        Scanner key  = new Scanner(System.in);<n>        String  question = key.nextLine();<n>        String  answer=key.nextLine(); <n>        System.out.println("Your Answer: "+answer+"\nYour Answer Correct:"+ correct(question,answer));<n><n><n>    }<n><n><n>    //method to find index of a word in sentence<n>    private static int correctIndex(String query,String sentence){<n>        for(int i=0;i<sentence.length();i++){<n>            if(sentence.charAt(i) == query.charAt(i)){<n><n>                return i;<n>            }<n>        }<n>        return -1;<n>    }<n><n>    //method that finds correct answer<n>    public static String correctAnswer(String question,String answer){<n>        String correct = null;<n>        if(question.length() == 5){<n>            int index= correctIndex(answer,question);<n><n>            if(index!=-1){<n>               correct = question.substring(0, index);<n>            }<n>        else{<n>            correct = "Try Again.....";<n>        }<n>    }<n><n>        else if(question.length == 6){<n>            int index = correctIndex(answer, question);<n>            if(index== -1){<n>                correct = "Try Again....";<n>            }}<n><n>    //method 5<n>        else if(correctIndex(answer,question) == 1){<n>            correct = answer.charAt(0);<n>        }<n>        else if(query.compareTo(answer) > 0){<n>            correct = query;<n>            }<n>    else if(query.charAt(0) < answer.charAt(1)){<n>          correct = answer;<n>        }<n>    //method to give the correct answer after finding it<n>    else <n>            {<n>                correct = answer.char(0);<n>                }<n><n>    System.out.println(question+"\n Your Answer: "+answer+" Your Answer Correct: "+correct);<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:You should write a test program to test your code.<n>```<n>public static
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input:If one sees a fox and is standing in a coastal, gulf state, where is this person? Choices:  A: alabama B: louisiana C: south carolina D: arkansas E: mountains<n>Output:		D: arkansas<n><n>Input: How much does a soccer player weigh? Choices:  G: 160 pounds B: 115 kilograms C: 80 pounds<n>Output: A: 160 lbs<n><n>Input: If one is looking for a job, where is one working? Choices: A: at work. B: a job C: working<n>Output: B: A job<n><n>Input: What do you call a female teacher? Choices: A. professor B. teacher lady C. teacher lady professor  D. teacher dude E. teacher dude professor  F. teacher dude lady<n>Output: B: Professor<n><n>### Solution:<n>https://leetcode.com/problems/find-the-next-greater-word/"<n>https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/find-the-greater-word-from-a-given-string/<n><n>### Solution Explanation:Solution for Leetcode<n>The algorithm works similar to a KMP(Knights Move Pattern) algorithm for a text.<n>We have an array and we have to find the next greater word from the string. As we look for each string we have to keep a position counter in which we check if the current substring is found. If it isn't found, the current substring is inserted into the word array and start searching for the next greater substring. If we find it we break out and continue searching the next substring.<n>The time complexity is O(m).<n><n>### Solution for solution1<n><n>This is a solution for Codeforces.<n><n>It is very similar to the solution for Java as it consists of a KMP algorithm for strings. Our algorithm contains a class word which contains the type string, a position counter and a word_counter. We have to do the same thing for the codeforces code. There is an array of words w and we have to sort and find the greatest substring. If the current substring is not found or is not in the words[] we must insert it. The algorithm works in a way that as we check every letter in the substrings, we have to check the positions for the previous letters. In the words[] we sort them and we iterate over them. At every iteration we find if the substring in the w array contains the previous substring in the current position. If we don't
